overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to time-series forecasting using simple averaging to handle daily seasonality. It considers advanced models like SARIMA and Holt-Winters but defaults to a heuristic method due to implementation constraints. The analysis effectively identifies patterns but acknowledges limitations like weekend variability and data's short history.
key_insights: Leveraging same-hour averages from multiple days to capture seasonality
Handling forecast limitations when historical patterns (weekdays) differ from future periods (weekends)
Data rounding to match input precision (3 decimal places)
Index-based data segmentation for efficient hourly pattern extraction
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines model evaluation (SARIMA, exponential smoothing) with practical heuristics. Features multi-step data processing including pattern identification, indexing, averaging, and datetime handling, but avoids advanced statistical implementations.
